intro: Malabaila vaginans, commonly known as the yellow-eyed grass, is a flowering plant belonging to the Poaceae family. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and Australia. The plant features slender, grass-like blades and produces small, yellowish-green inflorescences that bloom in clusters. Its botanical structure includes a fibrous root system and narrow, linear leaves. Malabaila vaginans is often found in wetland habitats and is adapted to thrive in moist, nutrient-rich soils.
